subject: RE: Obvious refactoring needed (Re: [junit] Re: JFCUnit  sample  codes.)
msgSnippet: Hi J.B., Thanks for the suggestions.  Sometimes I miss obvious changes to my code.  It always helps to have an extra pair of eyes reading code. Thanks, Kris
messageBody:
Hi J.B.,

Thanks for the suggestions. Sometimes I miss obvious changes to my
code. It always helps to have an extra pair of eyes reading code.

Thanks,
Kris


> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 11, 2003 1:14 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Obvious refactoring needed (Re: [junit] Re: JFCUnit
> sample codes.)
>
>
> >> I've used JFCUnit a little bit. Here are some test
> methods I wrote:
> >>
> >> private Component assertNotNullAndShowing(String name,
> Container
> >> container, int index)
> >> {
> >> Component component = m_helper.findNamedComponent(name,
> >> container, index);
> >> assertNotNull("Could not find " + name, component);
> >> assertTrue(name + " is not showing",
> component.isShowing());
> >>
> >> return component;
> >> }
> >>
> >> public void testComponents()
> >> {
> >> //Check to make sure all the visible components
> are showing.
> >>
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("AddButton", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("DeleteButton", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("ConnectButton", m_dialog, 0);
> >>
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("SelectADeviceLabel", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("ScrollPane", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("Table", m_dialog, 0);
> >>
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("Separator", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("AccessLevel", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("GuestRadio", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("OperatorRadio", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("AdministratorRadio", m_dialog, 0);
> >>
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("PasswordLabel", m_dialog, 0);
> >> assertNotNullAndShowing("PasswordField", m_dialog, 0);
> >> }
>
> Ug-LY!
>
> public void testVisibleComponentsAreShowing()
> {
> String[] componentsShouldBeShowing = new String[] {
> "AddButton", "DeleteButton", "ConnectButton",
> "SelectADeviceLabel", "ScrollPane", "Table",
> "Separator", "AccessLevel", "GuestRadio",
> "OperatorRadio", "AdministratorRadio",
> "PasswordLabel", "PasswordField"
> };
>
> for (int i = 0; i < componentsShouldBeShowing.length; i++) {
>
> assertNotNullAndShowing(componentsShouldBeShowing [i], m_dialog, 0);
> }
> }
>
> 1. Don't comment; improve the name.
> 2. Make loops when obvious.
>
> Take care.
>
> [PS: I'm not picking on you, but when you provide "sample"
> code, it shouldn't encourage duplication. :) ]
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> President, Diaspar Software Services
> Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
